text: When i create a child theme all templates / modules not cloned only few templates cloned, if
Modules and templates will not be cloned.

That's correct, if they are cloned then they overwrite the parent. You don't want that, you want them to be inherited.

You would only overwrite them (clone to child) if you want to customize something and make it unique.

In most cases is better to clone and rename so it's completely new/unique rather than overwriting.
I will create the page content stage, but what about the header and footer? How can I design a new header and footer with a new theme?
If you create a new header and footer, the theme settings will not apply to them.
So I need to create the header and footer as a module, not as a global module.?

The easiest option would be to overwrite the header and footer files from the parent to the child, then you can replace the content with your new header while keeping the same file structure of the theme
